summary_chunk: Isa Whitney, the brother of the late Elias Whitney, had developed an addiction to opium in an attempt to emulate the dreams and sensations described by DeQuincey. After becoming a slave to the drug, he ended up the object of pity and horror to his friends and family. One night, Isa's wife, Kate, arrived at the narrator's house, frantic and worried about her husband who had not been home for two days. Isa had reportedly been spending his time in an opium den in the far east of the city. Though his past visits had only lasted a day, he had now been gone for 48 hours, likely among the city's dregs, either inhaling the drug or sleeping off its effects. Kate believed he could be found at the Bar of Gold, in Upper Swandam Lane.
